para.displaydata: Condition: One of these occurs:

■ An engine failure
■ An ENG FAIL alert shows
■ An engine flameout
■ Another checklist directs an engine shutdown.
<font size="14">1 Do an engine shutdown only when flight conditions allow.</font>
<font size="14">2 Autothrottle (if engaged) . . . . . . . . . . .Disengage</font>

3 Thrust lever
(affected engine) . . . . . . Confirm . . . . . . . Close

4 If conditions allow:
Run the engine for three minutes at idle thrust.

5 Engine start lever
(affected engine) . . . . . . Confirm . . . . . CUTOFF
<font size="14">6 PACK switch (affected side) . . . . . . . . . . . . . OFF</font>
<font size="14">This causes the operating pack to regulate to high flow in flight with flaps up.</font>
<font size="14">7 Choose one:</font>
<font size="14"> ■ APU is available for start:</font>

When APU is running:
APU GEN switch
(affected side) . . . . . . . . . . . . .ON
►►Go to step 8
■ APU is not available:
►►Go to step 8
<font size="14">8 Balance fuel as needed.</font>
<font size="14">9 Transponder mode selector . . . . . . . . . . . . . . TA</font>
<font size="14"> This prevents climb commands which can exceed single engine performance capability.</font>
<font size="14">10 Transponder mode selector . . . . . . . . . . TA ONLY</font>
<font size="14"> This prevents climb commands which can exceed single engine performance capability.</font>
11 If wing anti–ice is needed:
<font size="14"> ISOLATION VALVE switch . . . . . . . . . . . AUTO</font>
<font size="14">12 Plan to land at the nearest suitable airport.</font>
►►Go to the One Engine Inoperative Landing checklist on page 7.26
